{"id":1281713432,"question_id":3447,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"8Â months","timestamp":1717859179,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"5 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1281713432/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Clear Digits","memory":"7.5 MB","code":"/*You are given a string s.\n\nYour task is to remove all digits by doing this operation repeatedly:\n\nDelete the first digit and the closest non-digit character to its left.\nReturn the resulting string after removing all digits.\n*/\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    string clearDigits(string s) { \n//s consists only of lowercase English letters and digits.\n//The input is generated such that it is possible to delete all digits.\n        string ans;\n        int n = s.length();\n        \n        for(int i=n-1; i>0; i--) {\n            if(s[i]==-1)\n                continue;\n            //look for digit.\n            if( !(s[i]>='0' && s[i] <='9') ) { //letter\n                continue;\n            }\n            //found a digit.\n            s[i] = -1; //marked as 'to be deleted.'\n            //look for a non digit.\n            for(int j=i-1; j>=0; j--) {\n                if( !((s[j]>='0' && s[j] <='9') || s[j]==-1) ) {//letter\n                    s[j] = -1;  //marked as 'to be deleted' \n                     break; //letter.\n                };                \n            }\n        }\n\n        for(int i=0; i<n; i++) {\n            if(s[i]!=-1)\n                ans+=s[i];\n        };\n        return ans;\n        \n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"clear-digits","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
